description: [Status: stable] [Name: string-dot-format-extra-positional-arguments] [Message: .format call has unused arguments at position(s): {message}] What it does Checks for str.format calls with unused positional arguments. Why is this bad? Unused positional arguments are redundant, and often indicative of a mistake. They should be removed. Example "Hello, {0}".format("world", "!") Use instead: "Hello, {0}".format("world") Fix safety This rule's fix is marked as unsafe if the unused positional argument contains a function call with potential side effects, because removing such arguments could change the behavior of the code. For example, the fix would be marked as unsafe in the following case: "Hello, {0}".format("world", print(1))
